meanings.definition: A group of notes played in a time span normally occupied by a different number of notes.
meanings.sent1: The musician played a tuplet of quick notes in the song.
meanings.sent2: In jazz music, tuplets are often used to create syncopated rhythms.
meanings.sent3: The tuplet of notes danced across the music sheet, surprising the pianist.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved like a tuplet of butterflies on the piano keys.
meanings.sent5: The tuplet of beats added a unique twist to the melody.

meanings.definition: A group of offspring produced at one birth.
meanings.sent1: The cat gave birth to a tuplet of kittens last night.
meanings.sent2: The farm was bustling with the arrival of a tuplet of piglets.
meanings.sent3: The tuplet of puppies cuddled together in a fluffy heap.
meanings.sent4: The tuplet of ducklings followed their mother in a straight line.
meanings.sent5: The tuplet of chicks chirped happily under the heat lamp.
